com.appboy.ui.inappmessage

Interface IInAppMessageView

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IInAppMessageImmersiveView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppboyInAppMessageBaseView, AppboyInAppMessageFullView, AppboyInAppMessageHtmlBaseView, AppboyInAppMessageHtmlFullView, AppboyInAppMessageHtmlView, AppboyInAppMessageImmersiveBaseView, AppboyInAppMessageModalView, AppboyInAppMessageSlideupView

    public interface IInAppMessageView
    InAppMessageBase is the base view interface for all in-app messages. It implicitly defines policy for in-app message views that can be manipulated from outside the object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyWindowInsets(WindowInsetsCompat insets)
      Called when the WindowInsetsCompat information should be applied to this in-app message.
      android.view.View getMessageClickableView()
      Gets the clickable portion of the in-app message so that Braze can add click listeners to it.
      boolean hasAppliedWindowInsets()
      Helper method to prevent WindowInsetsCompat from getting applied multiple times on the same in-app message view.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageClickableView

        android.view.View getMessageClickableView()
        Gets the clickable portion of the in-app message so that Braze can add click listeners to it.
        Returns:
        the View that displays the clickable portion of the in-app message. If the entire message is clickable, return this.

      • applyWindowInsets

        void applyWindowInsets(WindowInsetsCompat insets)
        Called when the WindowInsetsCompat information should be applied to this in-app message. WindowInsetsCompat will typically only be applied on notched devices and on Activities displaying inside the screen cutout area.

        Implementations of this method are expected to modify any necessary margins to ensure compatibility with the argument notch dimensions. For example, full screen in-app messages should have their close buttons moved to not be obscured by the status bar, slideups should not render behind the notch, and modal in-app messages will have no changes since they do not render in the cutout area.

        The screen has a notch if WindowInsetsCompat#getDisplayCutout() is non-null. The system window insets (e.g. WindowInsetsCompat#getSystemWindowInsetTop() will be present if the status bar is translucent or the status/navigation bars are otherwise non-occluding of the root Activity content.
        Parameters:
        insets - The WindowInsetsCompat object directly from android.support.v4.view.ViewCompat#setOnApplyWindowInsetsListener(View, OnApplyWindowInsetsListener).

      • hasAppliedWindowInsets

        boolean hasAppliedWindowInsets()
        Helper method to prevent WindowInsetsCompat from getting applied multiple times on the same in-app message view.
        Returns:
        Whether WindowInsetsCompat has been applied to this in-app message.
        See Also:
        applyWindowInsets(WindowInsetsCompat)
